block.p: Pamela Lynne Haas, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David R. Haas of Pound Ridge, N.Y., was married last evening to Clarence Boris Schwab, a son of Dr. George D. Schwab of New York and the late Eleonora Storch Schwab. Rabbi Robert A. Rothman officiated at the Pegasus Suite at the Rainbow Room in New York.

The bride, a cum laude graduate of Bowdoin College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Columbia University, received master's degrees from Harvard University, she in education and he in business administration.

Pamela Lynne Haas, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David R. Haas of Pound Ridge, N.Y., was married last evening to Clarence Boris Schwab, a son of Dr. George D. Schwab of New York and the late Eleonora Storch Schwab. Rabbi Robert A. Rothman officiated at the Pegasus Suite at the Rainbow Room in New York.

The bride, a cum laude graduate of Bowdoin College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Columbia University, received master's degrees from Harvard University, she in education and he in business administration.

Ms. Haas, 30, is keeping her name. She is the associate director of the New York office of Facing History and Ourselves, an organization that trains and supports educators in the issues of tolerance and social justice. Her father, an independent financial consultant in New York, was until 1994 a senior vice president and the controller of Time Warner in New York.

Mr. Schwab, 30, is the senior associate for mergers and acquisitions in the energy and utility group of Wasserstein Perella & Company, the New York investment bank. His father is an emeritus professor of history at the City College and the Graduate Center of the City University of New York and the president of the National Committee on American Foreign Policy, a nonprofit educational forum and policy institute.
